definition: 1. (Med.) (a) Same as Callosity. (b  The material of repair in fractures of bone; a substance exuded at the site of fracture, which is at first soft or cartilaginous in consistence, but is ultimately converted into true bone and unites the fragments into a single piece. 2. (Hort.)  The new formation over the end of a cutting, before it puts out rootlets.
